(Going to Cybertron would be cool.  If an RPG died because of it would be 
because no one wanted to go Cybertron (obvious there) or because it wasn't 
done right.  Cybertron isn't really explored that much in the American 
Transformers cartoon, which is the only one I've seen.  I'd agree with LN, 
don't base it on Beast Machines.  Yuk.  

Also, on Cybertron, we could do more stuff.  In example, the first two 
seasons of TFs, undoubtedly the best but I guess you could say 'restricted' 
to Earth and occassional visits to Earth.  Season three, undoubtedly not the 
best, did have many episodes OFF of Cybertron and Earth.  Going to different 
planets, etc.  A good concept there, even if most art and writing was...shall 
we say lacking?  Again, season three wasn't the best but it had a LOT of 
opportunities that this RPG would have as well.  Not to mention we'd get to 
make our own Cybertron and, well, yeah, I went over that.

The biggest problem is we'd have to make our own Cybertron.  I mean, we know 
what Earth looks like, all the places, the geography.  Buuuut, we don't know 
that for Cybertron and we'd need to create it.

As for the protohumans, early in the RPG people were equipping huge gumby 
squads of protohumans with weapons and using them as massively destructive 
armies so they were banned, as they should be.  The RPG's got along fine with 
gumbies that can't fight.


-L. Unitron
